bot_owner.name: announce
bot_owner.description: It allows you to send announcements to the announcement channels in the servers where it has been set.

bot_owner.name: blacklist
bot_owner.description: It allows you to blacklist users and servers that. Blacklisted servers and users don't have access to Bastion's commands.

bot_owner.name: commandModule
bot_owner.description: It allows you to temporarily enable or disable a command module until the next restart. It also allows you to check whether the command is currently enabled.

bot_owner.name: eval
bot_owner.description: It allows you to execute JavaScript code inside Bastion's context.

bot_owner.name: exec
bot_owner.description: It allows you to execute commands in the termial where Bastion is running.

bot_owner.name: relayDirectMessages
bot_owner.description: It allows you to toggle Bastion's Direct Message Relay. If enabled, Bastion will relay all direct messages to the bot owners.

bot_owner.name: reloadSettings
bot_owner.description: It allows you to reload Bastion's settings without needing to restart Bastion.

bot_owner.name: setAvatar
bot_owner.description: It allows you to update Bastion's avatar directly from Discord.

bot_owner.name: setNick
bot_owner.description: It allows you to update Bastion's nickname in the server.

bot_owner.name: setPresence
bot_owner.description: It allows you to update Bastion's presence in the shard.

bot_owner.name: setUsername
bot_owner.description: It allows you to update Bastion's username directly from Discord.

bot_owner.name: shutdown
bot_owner.description: It allows you to shutdown Bastion directly from Discord.

comics.name: garfield
comics.description: It allows you to see the latest Garfield comic strip.

comics.name: xkcd
comics.description: It allows you to see the latest xkcd comic strip.

configuration.name: announcements
configuration.description: It allows you to enable (and disable) Bastion's Announcements in the server. It sets the channel as the Announcement Channel that will receive the announcement broadcasts sent by the bot owners using the `announce` command.

configuration.name: autoRoles
configuration.description: It allows you to set up Auto Roles in the server. Auto Roles are the roles which are assigned to users automatically when they join the server. You can optionally set up Auto Roles for either bots or humans.

configuration.name: farewells
configuration.description: It allows you to enable (and disable) farewells in the server. It also allows you to set farewell message and timeout.

configuration.name: gambling
configuration.description: It allows you to enable (or disable) gambling in the server. When enabled, members can use their Bastion Coins to gamble in games.

configuration.name: gamification
configuration.description: It allows you to enable (or disable) gamification in the server. When enabled, users gain experience and level up in the server by participating in the server, competing against each other to climb the leaderboard. It also allows you to toggle level up messages and set the level up multiplier.

configuration.name: greetings
configuration.description: It allows you to enable (and disable) greetings in the server. It also allows you to set greeting message and timeout.

configuration.name: inviteFilter
configuration.description: It allows you to enable (and disable) Invite Filter in the server. And it also allows you to configure if violation of this filter should be considered an infraction.

configuration.name: languages
configuration.description: It allows you to see the languages available in Bastion and set one of them as the default language for your server.

configuration.name: linkFilter
configuration.description: It allows you to enable (and disable) Link Filter in the server. And it also allows you to configure if violation of this filter should be considered an infraction.

configuration.name: membersOnly
configuration.description: It allows you to enable (and disable) Members Only mode in the server. If enabled, only the members who have at least one role in the server can use Bastion.

configuration.name: mentionSpam
configuration.description: It allows you to set (and unset) the threshold for mention spam in the server. If set, Bastion will warn the users who violate this and add it to their infractions.

configuration.name: messageFilter
configuration.description: It allows you to enable (and disable) Message Filter in the server. When enabled, it filters the messages that matches the patterns specified by you. And it also allows you to configure if violation of this filter should be considered an infraction.

configuration.name: moderationLogs
configuration.description: It allows you to enable (and disable) logging of the moderation events in the server. It sets the channel as the Moderation Log Channel that will log the moderation events in the server.

configuration.name: prefix
configuration.description: It allows you set custom prefixes for Bastion in your server.

configuration.name: reactionAnnouncements
configuration.description: It allows you to enable (and disable) Reaction Announcements in the server. If enabled, and an Announcement Channel is set, when someone with proper permission adds a Megaphone or Loudspeaker reaction to a message, the message gets announced in the Announcement Channel.

configuration.name: reactionPinning
configuration.description: It allows you to enable (and disable) Reaction Pinning in the server. If enabled, when someone with proper permission adds a Pin reaction to a message, the message gets pinned in the channel.

configuration.name: reports
configuration.description: It allows you to enable (and disable) user reports in the server. It sets the channel as the Report Channel that will receive the user reports, reported by the server members using the `report` command.

configuration.name: selfRoles
configuration.description: It allows you to set up Self Roles in the server. Self Roles are the roles which server members can assign (and unassign) to themselves.

configuration.name: serverLogs
configuration.description: It allows you to enable (and disable) logging of the server events. It sets the channel as the Server Log Channel that will log the server events.

configuration.name: starboard
configuration.description: It allows you to enable (and disable) Starboard in the server. It sets the channel as the Starboard Channel that will log the starred messages of the server.

configuration.name: streamerRole
configuration.description: It allows to set the Streamer Role for the server. When a member goes live in the server, they're assigned to this role, provided they have at least one role in the server.

configuration.name: streamers
configuration.description: It allows you to follow streamers, from various platforms, in the server. When the streamers go live, or post a video, Bastion will notify about it in the server.

configuration.name: suggestions
configuration.description: It allows you to enable (and disable) suggestions in the server. It sets the channel as the Suggestion Channel that will receive the suggestions, suggested by the server members using the `suggest` command.

configuration.name: triggers
configuration.description: It allows you to add (and remove) Triggers in the server. When a trigger is set, and Bastion sees a message from a human containing the pattern specified in the trigger, it'll respond with either the specified response message or reaction, or both.

configuration.name: voiceSessions
configuration.description: It allows you manage Voice Sessions (or Temporary Voice Channels, if you prefer), in the server.

configuration.name: votingChannels
configuration.description: It allows you to set (and unset) channels as Voting Channels. If a channel is set as a Voting Channel, anything sent in the channel will be set up for everyone to vote.

games.name: acrophobia
games.description: It allows you to play the Acrophobia game with your fellow server members. Bastion generates a random acronym and players compete by racing to create the most coherent or humorous sentence that fits the acronym - a backronym. After the submissions are over, in the specified amount of time, everyone then votes anonymously for their favorite answer. The most popular backronym wins.

games.name: flip
games.description: It allows you to flip any number of coins and see the result.

games.name: gameServer
games.description: It allows you to fetch information from nearly any game server that makes its status publicly available.

games.name: roll
games.description: It allows you to roll dice and see the result. It supports dice notation.

games.name: rps
games.description: It allows you to play Rock Paper Scissor with Bastion.

games.name: russianRoulette
games.description: It allows you to play Russian Roulette. Let's see if you can last all the 7 rounds.

help.name: changelog
help.description: It allows you to see the changes that have been introduced in the current version of Bastion.

help.name: commands
help.description: It allows you the see the list of commands available in Bastion. You can also use it to search for commands matching a given query.

info.name: avatar
info.description: It allows you see the avatar of a user.

info.name: channel
info.description: It allows you see the information of a channel.

info.name: emoji
info.description: It allows you see the information of an emoji.

info.name: patrons
info.description: It allows you to see our Patrons, the amazing people who support the development of The Bastion Bot Project.

info.name: role
info.description: It allows you see the information of a role.

info.name: server
info.description: It allows you see the information of the server.

info.name: status
info.description: It allows you to see Bastion's status, at a glance. It also allows you to see status of the current shard.

info.name: user
info.description: It allows you see the information of a user.

management.name: channels
management.description: It allows you create, delete and update channels in the server.

management.name: giveaway
management.description: It allows you to run giveaway events in the server for at least an hour and at most a month. You can set any number of winners for the event. And it also allows you to reroll the winners, if need be, after the end of the event.

management.name: iam
management.description: It allows you add (and remove) yourself to (and from) the Self Roles set in the server.

management.name: leave
management.description: It allows you to ask Bastion to leave the server and clear all data it has on server and its members.

management.name: levelUpRoles
management.description: It allows you to add roles to a level. When members reach that level, they'll be awarded those roles.

management.name: lockdown
management.description: It allows you lockdown a channel in the server from users who don't have permission to manage messages or the channel.

management.name: prune
management.description: It allows you to prune members without any roles, from the server, based on how long they have been inactive.

management.name: reactionRoles
management.description: It allows you to create (and delete) Reaction Role Groups. A Reaction Role Group is a group of reactions emojis that can be used by a member on the Reaction Role Message to add (or remove) roles to themselves. Reaction Roles in a single group can also be set as mutually exclusive. It also allows you to assign emojis to roles, that can be used in reacting to the Reaction Role Message.

management.name: roles
management.description: It allows you create, delete and update roles in the server.

management.name: roleStore
management.description: It allows you to set up a Role Store in the server. Server managers can sell roles in the server and members can buy them with Bastion Coins.

management.name: suggest
management.description: It allows you send a suggestion to the suggestion staff, provided a Suggestion Channel has been set in the server.

moderation.name: ban
moderation.description: It allows you to ban (or soft ban) users from the server, and optionally clear their messages from the specified number of days. It also allows you to list all the users banned in the server.

moderation.name: case
moderation.description: It allows you to see the moderation case log for the specified case number.

moderation.name: clear
moderation.description: It allows you to clear a specified number of messages in a channel. You can optionally filter the messages that should be cleard based on the message author, or since when it was sent, or whether it is pinned or system message or a bot sent it.

moderation.name: deaf
moderation.description: It allows you to deafen (and undeafen) users in the server. Deafened users can't listen anything in the server's voice channels.

moderation.name: infractions
moderation.description: It allows you to list all your infractions.

moderation.name: kick
moderation.description: It allows you to kick users from the server.

moderation.name: nickname
moderation.description: It allows you to set (and unset) nicknames of the server members.

moderation.name: reason
moderation.description: It allows you to update the reason of a moderation case. Forgot to set a reason? Did a typo? Here's your second chance.

moderation.name: report
moderation.description: It allows you to report a server member to the moderators of the server, provided a Report Channel is set.

moderation.name: textMute
moderation.description: It allows you to text mute (and unmute) users in a channel (or category). Text muted users can't send messages in the channels they are muted.

moderation.name: unban
moderation.description: It allows you to unban the users who're banned in the server.

moderation.name: updateRoles
moderation.description: It allows you to update roles of server members.

moderation.name: voiceMute
moderation.description: It allows you to voice mute (and unmute) users in a channel. Voice muted users can't speak in the voice channels they are muted.

moderation.name: warn
moderation.description: It allows you to warn server members, as well as clear their infractions. It also allows you to list all the infractions.

music.name: music
music.description: It toggles Bastion's music support in the specified server. Once enabled, you can use all music commands in the server.

music.name: musicChannel
music.description: It allows you to set (and unset) Bastion's Music Channels.

music.name: musicMaster
music.description: It allows you to set (and unset) Bastion's Music Master role.

music.name: nowPlaying
music.description: It shows you the music track that is currently being played in the server.

music.name: pause
music.description: It allows you to pause the music track that is currently being played in the server.

music.name: play
music.description: It allows you to play a music in the server, from the given queury or from any supported source.
syntax: play Remember The Name by Ed Sheeran

music.name: queue
music.description: It allows you to see the current music queue of the server. It also allows you to clear, or shuffle the music queue as well as remove a song from the queue, or set (and unset) the queue in loop.

music.name: resume
music.description: It allows you to resume the music track that was paused in the server.

music.name: skip
music.description: It allows you to skip the music track that is currently being played in the server.

music.name: stop
music.description: It allows you to stop the current music playback in the server.

music.name: volume
music.description: It allows you to set the volume of the music track that is currently being played in the server.

player_stats.name: apexLegends
player_stats.description: It allows you to see the stats of any Apex Legends player in any supported platform.

player_stats.name: counterStrikeGlobalOffensive
player_stats.description: It allows you to see the stats of any Counter-Strike: Global Offensive player in any supported platform.

player_stats.name: destiny2
player_stats.description: It allows you to see the stats of any Destiny 2 player in any supported platform.

player_stats.name: fortnite
player_stats.description: It allows you to see the stats of any Fortnite player in any supported platform.

player_stats.name: overwatch
player_stats.description: It allows you to see the stats of any Overwatch player in any supported platform.

player_stats.name: pubg
player_stats.description: It allows you to see the stats of any Playerunknown's Battlegrounds player in any supported platform. It also allows you to see the stats in separate game modes.

player_stats.name: rainbow6
player_stats.description: It allows you to see the stats of any Rainbow 6 player in any supported platform.

player_stats.name: rocketLeague
player_stats.description: It allows you to see the stats of any Rocket League player in any supported platform.

profile.name: coins
profile.description: It allows you to see your Bastion Account.

profile.name: daily
profile.description: It allows you to claim Bastion Coins, that every member receives as a reward for being in the server. You can claim your rewards once every 24 hours.

profile.name: karma
profile.description: It allows you to give someone the sweet little internet points, we call karma, if you think they're worth it. You can give up to 3 karmas every 6 hours, so spend it wisely.

profile.name: leaderboard
profile.description: It allows you to see the leaderboard of your server. You're ranked based on your level, experience, karma, and Bastion Coins; in that exact order.

profile.name: profile
profile.description: It allows you to see your (or any of the server member's) Bastion Profile.

profile.name: rank
profile.description: It allows you to see your (or any of the server member's) rank, level, experience, and karma.

searches.name: anime
searches.description: It allows you to search for information on the specified anime.

searches.name: apod
searches.description: It allows you to discover the cosmos! Each day a different image or photograph of our fascinating universe is featured, along with a brief explanation written by a professional astronomer.

searches.name: cryptocurrency
searches.description: It allows you to see some information on the specified cryptocurrency.

searches.name: game
searches.description: It allows you to search for information on the specified game.

searches.name: manga
searches.description: It allows you to search for information on the specified manga.

searches.name: movie
searches.description: It allows you to search for information on the specified movie.

searches.name: pokemon
searches.description: It allows you to search for information on the specified Pok√©mon.

searches.name: tvShow
searches.description: It allows you to search for information on the specified TV Show.

searches.name: urbanDictionary
searches.description: It allows you to search the Urban Dictionary for definitions of the specified word.

searches.name: weather
searches.description: It allows you to see the current weather forcast of the specified location.

searches.name: wikipedia
searches.description: It allows you to search the Wikipedia for the specified title.

utility.name: calculate
utility.description: It allows you to evaluate mathematical expressions and see their result.

utility.name: choose
utility.description: It allows you to ask Bastion to choose an option from the given set of options. Let Bastion make a decision for you.

utility.name: cite
utility.description: It allows you to cite a message from any channel in the server.

utility.name: color
utility.description: It allows you the convert the specified color in one format into many differt formats.

utility.name: datetime
utility.description: It allows you to see the current time in multiple different time zones. It also allows you to convert the specified time into multiple different time zones.

utility.name: definitions
utility.description: It allows you to look up definitions for the specified word.

utility.name: echo
utility.description: It allows you to echo a message through Bastion. It also supports Bastion embed objects.

utility.name: followRedirects
utility.description: It follows all the redirects in the specified URL and allows you to see the final URL.

utility.name: invite
utility.description: It allows you to generate an instant invite for the server. Optionally, the invite can be a temporary which will kick the members from the server if they aren't assigned a role within 24 hours. It also shows you the invite link to invite Bastion to your server.

utility.name: lmstfy
utility.description: It allows you to send a LMGTFY link for the specified search query. Use it to teach people how to do an internet search and get answers to their questions.

utility.name: poll
utility.description: It allows you to run polls in the server for at least an hour and at most a month. You can set at most 13 options for the poll. It also allows you to see the status of a running poll.

utility.name: translate
utility.description: It allows you to translate the specified text from one language to another.
